title: FPS LAG AS GAME DRAGS ON
body:
FPS Lag. Starts at 60 FPS and as game progresses it steadily drops down to (NOT JOKING) 1-2 FPS. Only way to fix it is to restart the entire game/client. 

Also alt tab doesn't work. After the game ends, I cannot close the game and have to force quit each time. 

This happens on BOTH my PC and my Mac. I don't use my mac for gaming, but out of desperation I just wanted to play the game. Sadly it happens on there too and I thought switching would help the problem since my computer is so godly atm.

My PC is a pile of shit but my Mac is brand new high end and shouldn't have any issues. 

Mac stats:

4 GHz Itel Core i7 
Memory 32 GB 1867 MHz DDR3
Graphics: AMD Radeon R9 M395X 4096 MB

From research I have done it sounds like it might be 'memory leak' or something on Riot's end.
Also I have NO other programs running other than discord, I restart my computer and play when its fresh. My computer does NOT overheat. 



Please helpppppppp!!!!

replies.body:
Same for me here. Playing on my mac since 3 years without problems.
Past days having high FPS drop, sometimes unplayable (under 20 fps).
Macbook specs:
2,6 GHz Intel Core i7
16GB RAM
NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M 2048 Mo

Nothing weird on my mac on already checked everything.
I'm pretty sure it's about the last MAJ, since it consumes > 150% CPU
even on launcher since this MAJ.

That's.....hella weird that your FPS would slowly drop down to 1-2fps on two completely different computers. It might have something to do with your config files, so let's reset those using the steps below. Definitely hit me back if that doesn't help at all.

- Log into the game client
- Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
- Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
- Go into a practice game and verify that settings have saved properly. 
- Leave game to sync settings

I noticed this is happening to me a lot in Custom Games too... I can start the game as high as 122 FPS but I need to restart the game every ten minutes to fix it.

it doesn't seem to have this issue (for me) in Normals though.

Processor	AMD A10-5800K APU with Radeon(tm) HD Graphics, 3800 Mhz, 2 Core(s), 4 Logical Processor(s)
Memory Model	MAXTOR S TM3500630AS SATA Disk Device
Graphics         GeForce GTX 1070
